alert.note: Alert for Essex; Union (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 12 at 10:49PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Union and Essex counties in northeast New Jersey. * WHEN...Until 145 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1049 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. A quick downpour of 1/2 to 1 inch of rain in only 20 minutes will likely cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Newark, Plainfield, Bloomfield, Linden, Orange, Summit, Millburn, Caldwell, Clark, Fairfield, Union, East Orange, Irvington, West Orange, Montclair, Belleville, Westfield, Livingston, Nutley and Rahway. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
